original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di / 'di lta ste /
translated: filled with tathāgatas

original: dper na / 'dam bu'i byings sam /🔽'od ma'i tshal lam /🔽bu @273a *// ram shing gi tshal lam /
analyzed: dper na / 'dam bu'i byings sam / 'od ma'i tshal lam / bu @273a *// ram shing gi tshal lam /
translated: like a thicket of reeds,🔽a thicket of bamboo,🔽a grove of sugarcane,

original: smyig ma'i tshal lam /
analyzed: smyig ma'i tshal lam /
translated: a grove of sesame plants,

original: 'bras kyi zhing ngam /🔽til gyi zhing bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos yongs su gang bar gyur la /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang bskal pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras kyi zhing ngam / til gyi zhing bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos yongs su gang bar gyur la / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang bskal pa'am /
translated: or a field of rice,

original: bskal pa'i lhag mar chos bstan te /
analyzed: bskal pa'i lhag mar chos bstan te /
translated: and those tathāgatas were to teach the Dharma for an eon or the remainder of an eon,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa re res sems can tshad ma mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa re res sems can tshad ma mchis /
translated: and each tathāgata were to lead countless,

original: grangs ma mchis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang /
analyzed: grangs ma mchis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang /
translated: innumerable sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽sems can gyi khams la 'grib pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / sems can gyi khams la 'grib pa'am /
translated: Blessed One,🔽the realm of sentient beings would not decrease

original: gang bar mi gda'o //
analyzed: gang bar mi gda'o //
translated: or become full.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can ma mchis pa dang / sems can dpen pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: sems can ma mchis pa dang / sems can dpen pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because sentient beings are non-existent and sentient beings are isolated.

original: de bzhin du gal te phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing yang /
translated: Similarly, if in each of the ten directions

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: and it is like this:🔽for example,

original: dper na / 'dam bu'i byings sam /🔽'od ma'i tshal lam /🔽bu ram shing gi tshal lam /
analyzed: dper na / 'dam bu'i byings sam / 'od ma'i tshal lam / bu ram shing gi tshal lam /
translated: like a mass of reeds,🔽a forest of bamboo,

original: smyig ma'i tshal lam /
analyzed: smyig ma'i tshal lam /
translated: a forest of sugar cane,🔽a forest of hemp,

original: 'bras kyi zhing ngam /
analyzed: 'bras kyi zhing ngam /
translated: a field of rice,

original: til gyi zhing bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos yongs su gang bar gyur la /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang bskal pa'am /
analyzed: til gyi zhing bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos yongs su gang bar gyur la / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang bskal pa'am /
translated: or a field of sesame, it is filled with many Tathāgatas.🔽And those Tathāgatas teach the Dharma for an eon,

original: bskal pa'i lhag mar chos bstan te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa re res sems can tshad ma mchis /
analyzed: bskal pa'i lhag mar chos bstan te / de bzhin gshegs pa re res sems can tshad ma mchis /
translated: or for the remainder of an eon.🔽Each Tathāgata causes immeasurable,

original: grangs ma mchis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang /🔽sems can gyi khams la gang ba'am /
analyzed: grangs ma mchis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang / sems can gyi khams la gang ba'am /
translated: innumerable sentient beings to pass into complete nirvāṇa,

original: 'grib par mi gda'o //
analyzed: 'grib par mi gda'o //
translated: but the realm of sentient beings is neither increased nor decreased.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can ma mchis pa dang / sems can dben pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: sems can ma mchis pa dang / sems can dben pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because sentient beings do not exist and sentient beings are void.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na bdag @273b 'di skad du sems can rnams kyi slad du /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na bdag @273b 'di skad du sems can rnams kyi slad du /
translated: for that reason I say that for the sake of sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha' yongs su smin par bgyi bar 'tshal zhing yongs su dgrol bar 'tshal ba lags zhes mchi'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha' yongs su smin par bgyi bar 'tshal zhing yongs su dgrol bar 'tshal ba lags zhes mchi'o //
translated: They wish to ripen and liberate space.

original: de nas dge slong gcig cig 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gcig cig 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: Then a certain monk thought this:

original: gang la chos gang yang skye ba dang 'gag pa yang med la /
analyzed: gang la chos gang yang skye ba dang 'gag pa yang med la /
translated: “In this Dharma, there is no arising or ceasing of any dharma,

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po yang yod /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po yang yod /
translated: and yet there is the aggregate of morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yang yod /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yang yod /
translated: the aggregate of meditative stabilization, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation;

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang yod /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang yod /
translated: there is the fruit of entering the stream,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyang yod /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyang yod /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment,🔽and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang yod /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang yod /
translated: there is also unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening;

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'ang yod /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'ang yod /
translated: there is also stream enterer;

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyang yod /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyang yod /
translated: there is also once-returner, non-returner, and arhat;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang yod /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang yod /
translated: there is also a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha;

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang yod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang yod /
translated: there is also the jewel of the Buddha, the jewel of the Dharma, and the jewel of the Saṅgha;🔽there is also the turning of the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'ang yod pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo snyam pa dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'ang yod pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo snyam pa dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' @274a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @274a *//
translated: bodhisattva

original: sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par byed pa zhig yod na /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par byed pa zhig yod na /
translated: If there is a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is diligent in this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: de gang la brtson par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de gang la brtson par byed pa yin /
translated: what is it that he is diligent in?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab par sems pa de ni nam mkha' stong pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab par sems pa de ni nam mkha' stong pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: one who thinks to train in this perfection of wisdom is diligent in empty space.”

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods,🔽said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de la bdag gis bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de la bdag gis bsrung ba dang /
translated: I will guard, protect, and keep safe those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and properly pay attention to it.

original: bskyang ba dang / bskyab pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /
analyzed: bskyang ba dang / bskyab pa ji lta bu zhig bgyi /
translated: What kind of guarding, protecting, and keeping safe should I do for them?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: Lord, please teach me that.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to Śatakratu, head of the gods:

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: khyod kyis gang la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
analyzed: khyod kyis gang la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
translated: do you see that dharma which should be guarded, protected, and insured?”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: He replied, “Venerable monk Subhūti,

original: bdag gis gang la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis gang la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par bya ba'i chos de lta bu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see that dharma which should be guarded, protected, and insured.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: gal te rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na /
analyzed: gal te rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na /
translated: if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family stands in the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught,

original: de nyid de'i bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par 'gyur @274b ro //
analyzed: de nyid de'i bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par 'gyur @274b ro //
translated: that itself will be their guarding, protecting, and insuring.

original: gal te ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar gyur na /
translated: If they are separated from the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught,

original: de la mi'am mi ma yin pa glags tshol ba rnams kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //🔽gang ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ni /
analyzed: de la mi'am mi ma yin pa glags tshol ba rnams kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro // gang ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ni /
translated: and the demons who seek an opportunity will find one.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who do not stand in the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught should be known to be separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni nam mkha' la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par sems pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni nam mkha' la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par sems pa ste /
translated: those who think to protect, guard, and keep safe the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom are thinking to protect, guard, and keep safe space.

original: de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not succeed in their thought and will be worn out.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: khyod kyis sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang; dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par nus sam /🔽brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: khyod kyis sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang; dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par nus sam / brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Are you able to protect, guard, and conceal an illusion, a mirage, a dream, an echo, an optical aberration, a city of gandharvas, or a magical creation?”

original: bcun pa rab 'byor /🔽de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: bcun pa rab 'byor / de ni mi nus so //
translated: Śakra said, “No, Subhūti.”

original: smras pa / koo shi ka /
analyzed: smras pa / koo shi ka /
translated: Subhūti said, “Kauśika,🔽it is the same for bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who think to protect, guard, and conceal them will not succeed in their intention and will become exhausted.”

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ji snyam du sems /🔽khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'am /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab @275a *//
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems / khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'am / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab @275a *//
translated: what do you think?🔽Are you able to protect, guard, and conceal a tathāgata

original: par nus sam /
analyzed: par nus sam /
translated: or a tathāgata emanation?”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said, “No, Subhūti.”

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni mi nus so //
translated: it is not possible.

original: smras pa / koo shi ka /
analyzed: smras pa / koo shi ka /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: “Kauśika, in the same way, those who think to protect, guard, and defend the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom will not accomplish their intention and will become exhausted.

original: koo shi ka ;de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka ;de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Kauśika, what do you think?

original: khyod kyis chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par nus sam /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par nus sam /
translated: Can you protect, guard, and defend the dharma-constituent, the very limit of reality, suchness, and the inconceivable element?”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni mi nus so //
translated: it is not possible.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: smras pa / koo shi ka /
analyzed: smras pa / koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, those who think to protect, guard, and defend the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom will not achieve their thoughts and will have the misfortune of exhaustion.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to venerable Subhūti:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti,

original: ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na /
translated: to what extent

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam lta bu'i chos dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i chos rnams yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i chos dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i chos rnams yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: know dharmas that are like a dream, like an illusion, like a mirage, like an echo, like an apparition, like a city of the gandharvas, and like a magical creation?

original: de ltar yongs @275b su shes pas /
analyzed: de ltar yongs @275b su shes pas /

translated: They were asking about this very profound perfection of wisdom,🔽this very chapter of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu ba dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu ba dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu zhing yongs su 'dri ba sems kyis mthong bar gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu zhing yongs su 'dri ba sems kyis mthong bar gyur te /
translated: saw in his mind that they were asking about this very chapter of the perfection of wisdom and were inquiring about it.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing yang /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing yang /
translated: In the south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above, in each of the directions

original: sangs rgyas stong yi ge 'di dag nyid kyis chos ston pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas stong yi ge 'di dag nyid kyis chos ston pa /
translated: he saw a thousand buddhas teaching the Dharma with these very letters,

original: mtshan 'di nyid mnga' ba /
analyzed: mtshan 'di nyid mnga' ba /
translated: with these very names,🔽and with monks named Subhūti.

original: dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag gis /
analyzed: dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag gis /
translated: all of them were monks named Subhūti.🔽They were asking about this very profound perfection of wisdom, and this very chapter on the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu ba dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu ba dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu zhing yongs su 'dri ba sems kyis mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu zhing yongs su 'dri ba sems kyis mthong bar gyur to //
translated: saw in his mind that they were asking about this very chapter on the perfection of wisdom and were inquiring about it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa yang sa'i phyogs 'di nyid du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa yang sa'i phyogs 'di nyid du /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, in this very place,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will teach and explain this very perfection of wisdom.

original: gang yang bskal pa bzang po 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: gang yang bskal pa bzang po 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba de dag kyang /
translated: “Those tathāgatas, arhats, and completely perfect buddhas who will appear in this fortunate eon

original: sa'i phyogs 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par @278b rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: sa'i phyogs 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par @278b rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: will also fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening in this very place and

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: will teach and expound this very perfection of wisdom.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: rnam pa gang dang / rtags gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang / rtags gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: what are the aspects, what are the signs, and what are the indications by which the bodhisattva great being Maitreya, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur /
translated: will teach and expound this very perfection of wisdom?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: 'di la rab 'byor /
analyzed: 'di la rab 'byor /
translated: “Su­bhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas /🔽gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas / gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: when the bodhisattva great being Maitreya has attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,🔽he will not teach the sacred doctrine that physical forms are permanent

original: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // gzugs bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are impermanent.🔽He will not teach the sacred doctrine that physical forms are imbued with happiness

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are imbued with suffering.

original: gzugs bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the sacred doctrine that physical forms are a self

original: bdag med ces bya ba'am /🔽gzugs sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba'am / gzugs sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are not a self.🔽He will not teach the sacred doctrine that physical forms are attractive

original: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: or that they are unattractive.🔽He will not teach the sacred doctrine that physical forms are calm

original: gzugs zhi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs zhi zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are not calm.

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not teach the sacred doctrine that physical forms are fettered

original: gzugs bcings zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs bcings zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are liberated.

original: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not teach the sacred doctrine that physical forms are past

original: gzugs 'das zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs 'das zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are future.

original: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /🔽da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba'am @279a *//
analyzed: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am / da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba'am @279a *//
translated: He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘It is past,’🔽or ‘It is future,’ or ‘It is present.’🔽He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are permanent’🔽or ‘impermanent,’

original: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par shes pa bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rnam par shes pa bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is permanent’ or ‘The eye is impermanent.’

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is happiness’ or ‘The eye is suffering.’

original: rnam par shes pa bdag ces bya ba'am bdag med ces bya ba'am /🔽rnam par shes pa sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag ces bya ba'am bdag med ces bya ba'am / rnam par shes pa sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is the self’ or ‘The eye is not the self.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is pure’ or ‘The eye is impure.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is empty’ or ‘The eye is not empty.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is with signs’ or ‘The eye is signless.’

original: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is with aspirations’ or ‘The eye is without aspirations.’

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par shes pa bcings zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rnam par shes pa bcings zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is calm’ or ‘The eye is not calm.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is void’ or ‘The eye is not void.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is afflicted’ or ‘The eye is purified.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is produced’ or ‘The eye is extinguished.’🔽He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is appropriated’ or ‘The eye is unappropriated.’

original: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par shes pa 'das zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rnam par shes pa 'das zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is fettered’ or ‘The eye is liberated.’

original: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The eye is past’ or ‘The eye is future’ or ‘The eye is present.’

original: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor would he teach the Dharma saying, ‘It is present.’

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination are permanent,’

original: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor would he teach the Dharma saying, ‘They are impermanent.’

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Dependent origination is happiness,’

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
translated: nor would he teach the Dharma saying, ‘It is suffering.’

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Dependent origination is a self,’

original: bdag med ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba'am /
translated: nor would he teach the Dharma saying, ‘It is without a self.’

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Dependent origination is attractive,’

original: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhi zhes bya ba'am /
translated: nor would he teach the Dharma saying, ‘It is unattractive.’🔽He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Dependent origination is peaceful,’

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bcings zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bcings zhes bya ba'am /
translated: nor would he teach the Dharma saying, ‘It is not peaceful.’🔽He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Dependent origination is in bondage,’

original: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'das zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'das zhes bya ba'am /
translated: nor would he teach the Dharma saying, ‘It is liberated.’🔽He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Dependent origination has passed beyond sorrow,’

original: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘It is future,’🔽or ‘It is present.’

original: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston @279b par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston @279b par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘All the perfections,🔽all the emptinesses,🔽and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are permanent’

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rtag ces bya ba'am /🔽mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rtag ces bya ba'am / mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or ‘impermanent.’

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are happiness’

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘suffering.’

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are a self’

original: bdag med ces bya ba'am /🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba'am / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sdug ces bya ba'am /

original: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhi zhes bya ba'am /

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or ‘not peaceful.’

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bcings zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bcings zhes bya ba'am /

original: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun 'das zhes bya ba'am /🔽ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /

original: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are past’ or ‘They are future’ or ‘They are present.’

analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: They will not teach the doctrine saying that the dhāraṇī gateways are a self,

original: bdag med ces bya ba'am /🔽gzungs kyi sgo rnams sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba'am / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are not a self.🔽They will not teach the doctrine saying that the dhāraṇī gateways are beautiful,

original: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzungs kyi sgo rnams zhi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // gzungs kyi sgo rnams zhi zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are not beautiful.🔽They will not teach the doctrine saying that the dhāraṇī gateways are calm,

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzungs kyi sgo rnams bcings zhes bya ba'am /🔽grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // gzungs kyi sgo rnams bcings zhes bya ba'am / grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or that they are not calm.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams 'das zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams 'das zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They will not teach the doctrine saying that the dhāraṇī gateways are bound,

original: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or that they are freed.

original: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams @280b dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams @280b dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: They will not teach the doctrine saying that the dhāraṇī gateways are past,🔽or that they are future,🔽or that they are present.🔽They will not teach the doctrine saying that the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are permanent,

original: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or that they are impermanent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bde zhes bya ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bde zhes bya ba'am / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are happiness or suffering.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres par rnams bdag ces bya ba'am /🔽bdag med ces bya ba'am /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres par rnams bdag ces bya ba'am / bdag med ces bya ba'am / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are a self or not a self.🔽One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are attractive or unattractive.

original: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams zhi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams zhi zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are empty or not empty.🔽One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are with afflictions or without afflictions.

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bcings zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bcings zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are calm or not calm.🔽One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are void or not void.🔽One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are afflicted or purified.🔽One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are produced or extinguished.

original: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams 'das zhes bya ba'am /🔽ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams 'das zhes bya ba'am / ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are defiled or purified.🔽One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are increased or decreased.🔽One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are taken on or put down.

original: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One should not teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of the buddhas are past, future, or present.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: Up to and the knowledge of all aspects is permanent or impermanent.

original: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not teach the doctrine saying, ‘It is impermanent.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bad  zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bad  zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They will not teach the doctrine saying, ‘The knowledge of all aspects is suffering,’

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘It is not suffering.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: They will not teach the doctrine saying, ‘The knowledge of all aspects is a self,’

original: bdag med ces bya ba'am /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba'am / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug ces bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘It is not a self.’🔽They will not teach the doctrine saying, ‘The knowledge of all aspects is attractive,’

original: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zhi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zhi zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘It is unattractive.’🔽They will not teach the doctrine saying, ‘The knowledge of all aspects is calm’

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bcings zhes bya ba'am /🔽grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur @281a *//
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bcings zhes bya ba'am / grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur @281a *//
translated: or ‘It is not calm.’🔽They will not teach the doctrine saying, ‘The knowledge of all aspects is bound’🔽or ‘It is freed.’

original: ro; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'das zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ro; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'das zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They will not teach the doctrine saying, ‘The knowledge of all aspects is past,’

original: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or ‘It is future,’

original: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or ‘It is present.’

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then said, “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: “When the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya has attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood,

original: chos ni ji ltar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos ni ji ltar ston par 'gyur /
translated: how will he teach the Dharma?

original: ston na ci zhig gis ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: ston na ci zhig gis ston par 'gyur /
translated: If he teaches, what will he teach?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gzugs shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: “He will teach the Dharma of complete purity, saying, ‘Form is completely pure.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will teach the Dharma of complete purity, saying, ‘Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are completely pure.’

original: skye mched dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will teach the Dharma of complete purity, saying, ‘The sense bases, the elements, and dependent origination are completely pure.’

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will teach the Dharma in a pure way, saying, ‘All the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are pure.’🔽He will teach the Dharma in a pure way, saying, ‘The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms @281b par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms @281b par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: signlessness, and the wishlessness are pure.’

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will teach the Dharma in a pure way, saying, ‘The five eyes are pure. The six superknowledges are pure.’

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: “They will teach the doctrine of complete purity, saying, ‘The dhāraṇī gateways are completely pure.’

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: “They will teach the doctrine of complete purity, saying, ‘The powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are completely pure.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: “They will teach the doctrine of complete purity, saying, ‘Up to the knowledge of all aspects is completely pure.’🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then said, “Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o // rab 'byor / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because of the purity of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa @282a *//🔽nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su dag pa'i phyir /

translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because of the purity of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure because of the purity of all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
